title: Subtree
description: An object describing the availability of tiles, children, metadata, layers, and content in a subtree.

buffers.description: An array of buffers storing binary availability metadata.

bufferViews.description: An array of bufferViews indicating whether each element is available. Each buffer is a bitstream. If an element is available, its bit is 1, and if it is unavailable, the bit is 0. An element can correspond to a tile within a subtree, or a child tile of the subtree.

tileAvailability.description: The availability of tiles in the subtree. If not all available or unavailable, the size of the buffer will be `(N^subtreeLevels - 1)/(N - 1)` bits where N is 4 for tiling scheme `QUADTREE` and 8 for `OCTREE`.

childSubtreeAvailability.description: The availability of the children of the subtree. If not all available or unavailable, the size of the buffer will be N ^(subtreeLevels) bits where N is 4 for tiling scheme `QUADTREE` and 8 for `OCTREE`.

contentAvailability.description: The availability of the content of the tiles of the subtree. If not all available or unavailable, the size of the buffer will be `(N^subtreeLevels - 1)/(N - 1)` bits where N is 4 for tiling scheme `QUADTREE` and 8 for `OCTREE`.
